Finding aid for
Charles Fey papers, 1914-1970
titlepage.author:
Finding aid created by
Michigan Historical Collections staff

did.abstract: Birmingham, Michigan, businessman and Masonic historian; correspondence, research materials, and writings on freemasonry; also materials on other research interests, notably the history of Royal Oak and Royal Oak Township.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was the gift of Charles Fey (donor no. 3275).

accruals.p: No further additions to the papers are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Charles Fey papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Charles Fey was an Oakland County businessman and historian of freemasonry in Michigan.

scopecontent.p: The Charles Fey collection is comprised of correspondence conducted in the course of his research into the history of freemasonry in Michigan and in Oakland County in particular. The collection also includes extensive materials about individual masons. The collection is arranged into the following series: Scottish Rite Masonry in Michigan; Knight Templars in Michigan; Masonry in Oakland County, Michigan; Royal Arch and Grand Arch Masons in Michigan; Early Masonry and Leading Masons in Michigan; Masonic History; and Other research and personal interests.
